watershed: unnamed watershed in Yukon Coastal Plain
connectivity_def: connection between ice wedge polygon drainage channels
predictors: site (tributaory, main channel, outlet); date; depth below permafrost table
responses: various carbon measurements, DOC, POC, CDOM, carbon isotope analyses
notes: not relevant for meta-analysis; about carbon transport between terrestrial and aquatic systems; connectivity mentioned once: "Increased hydrologic connectivity of IWP troughs as well as increased connectivity via active-layer deepening in permafrost watersheds (Lafrenière and Lamoureux, 2019; Evans et al., 2020) may lead to higher input of terrestrial OM"
cc_notes: put none for connectivity_type because connectivity was not defined or analyzed in the paper, was only mentioned once in reference to other studies

temporal_def: measurements taken seasonally for one year
connectivity_def: separated lake groups by PCA, definition related to degree of connectivity with the river, but not clearly defined
predictors: connectivity rating, water depth, total phosphorus, macrophytes biomass, development of lake shoreline
notes: relevant chlorophyll information; connectivity categories were stated, but how they were determined is unclear, e.g. connectivity rating (CR) was numeric, but not defined; chlorophyll measured but not analyzed in response to connectivity

temporal_def: measurements taken at varying intervals over 20 months
responses: temperature, suspended solids, nitrogen, phosphorus, chlorophyll, algal biomass, silica
notes: chlorophyll conclusions: "average CHL concentrationsi n NC-11 and the S-19 backwater was much higher than in the river and S-19 forewater", "flushing during connection events always reduced CHL, though sometimes only slightly", "there is some evidence of algal-nutrient interactions"

temporal_def: measurements taken to capture seasonal variation between ice-out and ice-on
connectivity_def: absence of permafrost allows for increased connectivity to both surface flows and deeper flows
data_analysis_method: mixed effects modeling, structural equation m odeling
notes: studied lake characteristics, particularly methane and carbond dioxide flux, across latitudinal gradient
cc_notes: created a new connectivity metric for permafrost

latitude: see text for each station location
longitude: see text for each station location
connectivity_def: compared variables before and after reservoir construction
responses: reynolds functional groups, pH, DO, DIN, TIP, conductivity
notes: impact of river impoundment on phytoplankton community
cc_notes: connectivity metric difficult to classify, it was related to the impoundment event therefore e, also the stations differed in distance from the dam therefore a

responses: nitrate, chloride, sulphate, dissolved organic carbon, dissolved inorganic carbon
notes: aims to describe hydro-chemical signature of a livestock famring catchement
cc_notes: unsure of connectivity metric, classified as c because the precipitation level was used to designate base-flow or flood-flow category at the time of sample collection, but potentially a new category could be create for precipitation

temporal_def: three periods: premonsoon base flow, ,monsoon elevated base flow, return to base flow
connectivity_metric: degree of connectivity between reaches and with groundwater
connectivity_def: connectivity between reaches determined by mixing model with chloride concentrations
predictors: hydrologic period, land use, agricultural coverage
responses: DOC, TDN, oxygen isotope, chloride concentrations
notes: interested in the impact of hydrology and land use on water chemistry, studied carbon and nitrogen during nonflood conditions before, during, and after the monsoon season, concluded that instream "biogeochemical cycling during monsson season is influenced by antecedent conditions, specifically hydrologic connectivity, during the dry season"

predictors: rainfall intensity, rain duration, underground pore fissure degree
notes: used lab simulation to study the impact of rainfall on nitrogen loss from sloped farmland; explicity states that they do not consider connectivity in this study and that incorporating connectivity is a potential future direction for research
include_exclude_reason: does not address connectivity, but correctly passed abstract review

temporal_def: montly measurements, additional measurements during and after floods
connectivity_def: water level, whether lake received inflow from river
responses: total phospohorus, mean total nitrogen, mean chlorophyll, mean suspended solids
notes: "large blooms (peak CHL 81-689 ug/L) occurred in connected scours when low river levels reduced exchange with the river", oxbow lakes had higher chlorophyll than either protected or connected scour lakes
